author: Unreal Engine
description:
You’re building your game in Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN), and now it’s time to build your user interface, but you’re dreading the hundreds of lines of Verse UI code you’ll have to eventually write and manage. You’re wishing for something more visual; something that lets you build your UI and easily preview it. Where do you even start?

This talk demystifies the use of Unreal Motion Graphics UI Designer (UMG) to make a truly custom UI purely driven by devices, without the need for code. Attendees will walk away with an understanding of how to get started in UMG, how Viewmodels enable you to display custom UI on devices, and how to utilize different devices to showcase the UI that you want in your game.
title: UI 101: Getting Started with Unreal Motion Graphics for UEFN | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video to hear Netmarble Monster Founder and CEO Ken Kim discuss how his team built upcoming cross-platform collectible action-adventure game ‘MONGIL: STAR DIVE’ in UE5.

#MONGILSTARDIVE, #NetmarbleMonster, #ActionAdventureGame, #MonsterCollectingGame, #UnrealEngine5, #UE5
title: MONGIL: STAR DIVE | Developer Interview | Unreal Engine

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Discover how Unreal Engine, Datasmith and Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN) can transform your existing digital product assets into interactive 3D experiences.

In this session, Ian Southwell of Cleverlike Studios walks you through an example workflow that uses Blender and Epic software tools to import CAD models into UEFN islands. You'll also see some real-world applications of this workflow, and learn how scripting can automate and scale asset conversion for seamless integration into virtual environments.

Expand your business to the metaverse by seamlessly porting your physical products into the digital realm, and experience the power of the Epic Games toolset in bridging the gap between physical products and virtual experiences within the Fortnite ecosystem.
title: Bringing Your Product Catalog Into UEFN Experiences | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
